comments:
After having worked an entire day, i would check-in my work to the CVS.

Having checked in a part of the work, i make some kind of drag-operation with 
the mouse..

After this my project was deleted completely from the harddisk...

I'm not sure if this is the correct component....

The .log file entries do not have anything to do with drag and drop.

Are you sure you didn't drag the project to some other place like your desktop?

Can you provide reproducible steps?  What were you dragging?  The project?  A 
method?
Moving to JDT.  Looks like they have a null pointer exception.

The project was entirely deleted from my harddisk. I made a search from the 
command-prompt, for files which i knew was only within this project.

I believe, that it was the project i was dragging. 

Since i don't know precisely what i did, i can't reproduce it.

Both stack trace don't contain code from CVS or DND. I doubt that the are 
related to the behavoir described. IMO the bug is more related to bug 36729.

Moving back to SWT for comments.

Agreed, I think the log is not related to the problem.

In bug 36729, the user does not actually drag the mouse but a DragDetect is 
erroneously sent.  In the current bug report, the user has performed a drag 
and drop operation.

I will investigate both bugs.

Dan, if you can provide reproducible steps, that would help considerably.

Dan, I am unable to reproduce this bug.  A lot has changed since 2.1 in the 
area of drag and drop.  Please retry with Eclipse 3.0 and reopen bug report if 
problem continues to occur.
